p: Limonoids are divided into ten classes, including fifteen types based on different seco- styles, carbon-chain styles, and ring types [ 16]. This classification was presented by Fang et al. [ 16], who sought to identify the class and type of limonoids isolated from the Cedrela species. Table 10 shows the analysis performed with 55 chemical structures of limonoids isolated from different Cedrela species found in this review, showing the different seco-styles and carbon frameworks of these limonoid types.
